## Version control

Recording changes through snapshots of the same file.

<br>

<center>

![[Source: caltechlibrary](https://caltechlibrary.github.io/git-desktop/01-basics/)](img/play-changes.svg){width="900"}

</center>

## Version control

Collaborating with others on the same file.

<center>

![[Source: caltechlibrary](https://caltechlibrary.github.io/git-desktop/01-basics/)](img/versions.svg){width="500"}

</center>

## Version control

Merging changes from multiple people into one file.

<center>

![[Source: caltechlibrary](https://caltechlibrary.github.io/git-desktop/01-basics/)](img/merge.svg){width="500"}

</center>

## Version control

<br>

All this, while:

- Only having one copy of the file
- Never losing existing work
- Able to compare to previous versions
- Openly available (if wanted) and backed-up
